sense.name: a small divisive group within a larger organization
sense.commentary: FACTION[+organization][+subdivision][+small][+divisive] Note: often refers to political forces within a larger political entity
sense.examples: The most left-wing faction of the Democratic party does not endorse this candidate. Certain factions within the neo-conservative movement are breaking rank with the president.

sense.name: a state of conflict or dissension within a group
sense.commentary: FACTION[+state][+dissension][+ideological] Note: refers to a divisive state of affairs, rather than identifying a specific subgroup.
sense.examples: Members of the leadership are hoping to avoid a faction by this compromise. The power vacuum led to a faction among the revolutionary elite.
